discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
IP Helper is a feature used on routers or Layer 3 switches that allows the forwarding of DHCP broadcast messages from clients on one network to a DHCP server located on a different network. Since DHCP typically uses broadcast communication, a router will not forward this broadcast by default. By configuring an IP Helper Address, the router knows to forward the DHCP requests to the specified DHCP server.

questions.question_text:
A network administrator needs to connect a department to a new network segment. They need to use a DHCP server located on another network.

Which of the following can the administrator use to complete this task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
IaaS. This model allows organizations to essentially "lift" their existing physical servers and infrastructure onto the cloud provider's platform with minimal changes, making it ideal for a lift and shift migratio

questions.question_text: A network engineer is implementing a solution by which on-premises servers are migrated to a cloud service provider. Which of the following service models will provide a lift and shift solution to meet this requirement?

A network administrator is conducting an assessment and found network devices that do not meet standards. Which of the following configurations is considered a set of rules that devices should adhere to?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
In networking, a "golden configuration" is a standardized, optimal configuration template that ensures network devices are configured consistently and securely, aligning with organizational policies and industry best practices

Selected Answer: B
B. network map 

A highly detailed illustration of a network, down to the individual computers. A network map shows IP addresses, ports, protocols, and more.

Selected Answer: B
NMAP- It will allow for scanning of ports that are open. Great tool for listening and can be used for malicious purposes as well.

Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is B. nmap 

Nmap (Network Mapper) is the most appropriate tool for identifying open ports on the remote file server.

questions.question_text: A user notifies a network administrator about losing access to a remote file server. The network administrator is able to ping the server and verifies the current firewall rules do not block access to the network fileshare. Which of the following tools would help identify which ports are open on the remote file server?
An IT department asks a newly hired employee to use a personal laptop until the company can provide one. Which of the following policies is most applicable to this situation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
BYOD (Bring Your Own Device) is a policy that allows employees to use their personal devices (phones, laptops, tablets, etc.) for work-related activities, rather than relying solely on company-provided devices
